intro: Coccoloba floridana, commonly known as Florida laciniata, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of ponds and lakes in the southeastern United States. The plant has palmate leaves that are often divided into several lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Coccoloba floridana is adapted to wet, sandy soils and is often found in areas with high groundwater tables.
